subhead: According to French crime investigators, new power balances are emerging between two blocs on the Mediterranean island: the Petit Bar gang and the Mattei clan, which is uniting groups from various regions.

Michael Madsen, 'Reservoir Dogs' and 'Kill Bill' star, dead at 67
subhead: The US actor, best known for his frequent collaborations with director Quentin Tarantino, died on Thursday after suffering cardiac arrest, his management team said. Madsen was found unresponsive at his home in Malibu.

headline: Austria becomes first EU country to resume deportations of refugees to Syria
subhead: A 32-year-old Syrian man, who arrived in Austria in 2013 and was sentenced to seven years in prison in 2018, was deported on Thursday to his country of origin. Refugee aid organizations fear that this deportation – the first to Syria since the fall of Bashar al-Assad – could prompt other European Union countries to follow suit.

headline: Art weaves a thread between Paris and the Ukrainian frontline
subhead: French-based painter Polina Moroz asked a compatriot, an embroiderer mobilized in the Ukrainian army, to contribute to her canvases. These odes to summer and peace are now on display in Marseille.

headline: Champagne bubbles with excitement for 10th anniversary of its UNESCO designation
subhead: While bottle sales declined in 2024, especially abroad, the region has opened its hillsides, Champagne houses and cellars to visitors since 2015, sparking a tourism boom.

Water shortages in the upper Indian Himalayas are causing 'villages to die out and traditions to disappear'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating'  (4/6). Zanskar, located in the Ladakh region of India's mountain highlands, has felt the full force of glacier retreat. With no access to water, villagers have been abandoning their homes and traditional way of life.

headline: In Germany, Syrians still do not feel fully assimilated
subhead: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (2/5). Thanks to former chancellor Angela Merkel's asylum policy, Germany has taken in nearly half the Syrians seeking refuge in Europe since 2015. One of them, Amer Alqadi, a 39-year-old married father and naturalized citizen, believes that while the country still needs immigrants, its political climate has grown more tense.

headline: Far-right RN and allies face new embezzlement scandal at European Parliament
subhead: The now-defunct far-right Identity and Democracy group, which included Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National, misused €4.3 million in operating funds, according to a confidential report revealed by Le Monde and its partners.
